notes: Second generation Atlas on MQB platform. 2.0T four-cylinder or 3.6L VR6. Standard FWD or optional 4Motion AWD. Three rows of seating. Data sourced from Wikipedia Volkswagen Atlas article, January 2025 revision.

New compact crossover slotted below Tiguan. 1.5L turbocharged four-cylinder. Built on MQB platform. Standard FWD or optional 4Motion AWD. Data sourced from Wikipedia Volkswagen Taos article, January 2025 revision.

Third generation compact crossover on MQB Evo platform. 2.0L turbo four-cylinder. Standard FWD or optional 4Motion AWD. Available with third-row seating. Data sourced from Wikipedia Volkswagen Tiguan article, January 2025 revision.

Second generation compact crossover. North American version is longer-wheelbase variant. 2.0L turbo four-cylinder. Standard FWD or optional 4Motion AWD. Available with third-row seating. Data sourced from Wikipedia Volkswagen Tiguan article, January 2025 revision.

Seventh generation on MQB platform. Base 1.4T or 1.5T turbo four-cylinder, performance GLI with 2.0T. FWD only. Manual or automatic transmission. Data sourced from Wikipedia Volkswagen Jetta article, January 2025 revision.
North American market-specific Passat (NMS). 2.0L turbo four-cylinder. FWD only. Discontinued after 2022 model year. Data sourced from Wikipedia Volkswagen Passat article, January 2025 revision.

Seventh generation Golf on MQB platform. 1.4L turbo four-cylinder. FWD. Manual or automatic transmission. Discontinued in North America after 2021. Data sourced from Wikipedia Volkswagen Golf article, January 2025 revision.
Eighth generation performance hatchback. 2.0L turbo four-cylinder with 241 hp. FWD. Manual or DSG dual-clutch transmission. Data sourced from Wikipedia Volkswagen Golf article, January 2025 revision.

High-performance Golf R. 2.0L turbo four-cylinder with 315 hp. Standard 4Motion AWD. Manual or DSG dual-clutch transmission. Data sourced from Wikipedia Volkswagen Golf article, January 2025 revision.

Premium fastback sedan on MQB platform. 2.0L turbo four-cylinder. Standard FWD or optional 4Motion AWD. Discontinued in North America after 2021. Data sourced from Wikipedia Volkswagen Arteon article, January 2025 revision.

engines: EV: Single electric motor (201 hp RWD)
EV: Dual electric motors (295 hp AWD)
notes: All-electric compact crossover on MEB platform. 82 kWh battery pack. RWD with single motor or AWD with dual motors. Requires EV-certified technicians for high-voltage system service. Data sourced from Wikipedia Volkswagen ID.4 article, January 2025 revision.
